Articles.Content:
Now you too can recreate Jurassic park in kerbal space program - what a time to be alive

dinosaurs currently available - 

brontosaurus- [https://mega.co.nz/#!PYcxiTQS!TaMSeFOrQp98T1osV_HjZHho4HIrJzZ5J6jgEpYjmRo](https://mega.co.nz/#!PYcxiTQS!TaMSeFOrQp98T1osV_HjZHho4HIrJzZ5J6jgEpYjmRo)

stegosaurus- [https://mega.co.nz/#!zVlmiISA!NSHm_vnW1pu-ZsX_EpGbx1neppI3F6jX2-heETYRLWk](https://mega.co.nz/#!zVlmiISA!NSHm_vnW1pu-ZsX_EpGbx1neppI3F6jX2-heETYRLWk)

triceratops- [https://mega.co.nz/#!KYUTRQwS!VN93FZTn37rkGgHc13XDG8omIhyd4ZmHPKOEpuKEvw0](https://mega.co.nz/#!KYUTRQwS!VN93FZTn37rkGgHc13XDG8omIhyd4ZmHPKOEpuKEvw0)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/3PAWY)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/T9WHG)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/X4R0S)

disclaimer - all dinosaurs are purely aesthetic and do not come with rockets or other landing aids.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-11T21:09:51Z" title="04/11/2015 09:09  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 11, 2015</time> by landfish2**
  
added triceratops

Are kerbals from those pictures alive now? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Nice idea, landfish2!)

Very nice!

I love the heads. +rep

> 
> Are kerbals from those pictures alive now? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> Nice idea, landfish2!)

I believe both the brontosaurus and the stegosaurus were herbivores, so they should be fine...

...unless the theories of kerbals being actually plant-like creatures are true, in which case you shouldn't get your hopes high. Especially since there is absolutely no vegetation on Laythe or Duna and the dinos must be hungry ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Unless they eat the kerbals.

Very nice, landfish!

I have always suspected that the Kerbal is, in fact, a plant. We cannot assume that sentient life on other worlds would take the same form as our own. Research (aka. hypothesizing without any true evidence, and claiming to have said evidence anyway) into the possible reproduction process of a Kerbal has revealed that there is a high likelihood that pollen-based transfers of genetic material may be a key part of the process.

The lack of physical differences between males and females of the species, if they do physically exist separately at all, is also a good sign that there is something else at work here.

Nice! I love making random stuff, too. But beware on Laythe! A [Space Shark](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114754-Space-Shark) might come up and eat your Brontosaurus! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

By the way, 12 posts and >100 rep points? YouÃ‚Â´re rivaling KerrMÃƒÂ¼, my friend!
Congratulations on having your creations featured on the Facebook page!! Can't wait to see more of your future work.

Awesome, although they did spell my name LandFish1 which is the name of my evil twin brother.

Curse you landfish1

Inspired by yours, I have decided to make my own dinosaur!

ItÃ‚Â´s a T-Rex that also serves as a rover or mun lander. Check it out [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115369-T-Rex-Planetary-Exploration-Vehicle)!
Triceratops now available, for when you want to be like a unicorn, but with more, ya know horn
Break the internet by making a Pony shaped craft !!!
